citation.article-title: Emended descriptions of the genus Persicobacter and of Persicobacter diffluens and description of Persicobacter psychrovividus sp. nov. isolated from shellfishes
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of Persicobacter diffluens Nakagawa et al. 1997
Displays the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
Cells grown on Bacto marine agar at 30 °C for 3–9 days are 0.9–30 μm in length and 0.4–0.5 μm in diameter.
The cell mass is pink to orange.
Growth occurs at 15–40 °C with an optimum at 30–35 °C.
The pH range for growth is pH 6–11 with an optimum at pH 7.0.
Growth occurs in the presence of 1–5 % NaCl with an optimum at 3 %.
Some strains can grow at 45 °C, at pH 3 or with 7 % NaCl.
Catalase-positive.
Nitrate is reduced.
H2S and indole are not produced.
Agar, alginate, carboxymethylcellulose, DNA, aesculin, gelatin and yeast cells are degraded, but crystalline cellulose (i.e. filter paper) and tyrosine are not.
Tween 80 is weakly degraded or not degraded.
Starch and chitin are weakly degraded.

The following carbon sources are assimilated in the Biolog GN2 MicroPlate: l-alanine, l-asparagine, cellobiose, α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, d-galactose, α-d-glucose, glycogen, glycyl l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, dl-lactic acid, α-d-lactose, maltose, d-mannose, l-threonine and d-trehalose.
Alaninamide, d-fructose, l-fucose, gentiobiose, glucose 1-phosphate, lactulose and l-rhamnose are weakly assimilated. N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, l-aspartic acid and l-glutamic acid are not assimilated.

In the API 50CH system, acid is produced from N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, cellobiose, aesculin, galactose, gentiobiose, glucose, glycogen, lactose, maltose, mannose, salicin, starch and trehalose.
Acid is not produced from the other substrates in the API 50CH system.
The major cellular fatty acids (>5 %) are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, anteiso-C15 : 0 and C16 : 0.
The DNA G+C content is 42.6–43.8 mol%.
The type strain, B-1 LewinT (=ATCC 49458T=DSM 3658T=JCM 8513T=LMG 13036T=NBRC 15940T=NCIMB 1402T), was isolated from black sandy mud in India.
